reviews.review_msg: The course was very interesting. She is very inspirational for me. Lots of interesting discussions and readings. She is fair and very supportive.

This is a must-take for any sociology student. Yildiz is an incredible woman, super kind and interesting and passionate, and is really good at getting to know the class and making it a really comfertable and open space. There are a fair amount of weekly readings, but all are great, and assignments are easy if you do the readings. A feminists dream!

Yildiz was a fair marker, and was personally encouraging to me. Was always at office hours to answer my questions. I have to say that so far, this was one of the best courses I have taken at SFU. At the end of semester I felt like I had learned a lot. Do go to class and make sure you keep up with the readings. No midterms or final.

Yildiz is very upbeat & cheerful, great for engaging the class in the course materials. There is quite a lot of in depth reading & writing & presentations required for this class.  At least she is a fair marker.

Absolutely love her. No final exams, no big papers, only in depth examination of the readings. Not for anyone who thinks they can get a grade just for showing up. She is challenging but so worth it. Plus the group presenting brings food for the class, how cool is that?

Took this class because I thought it would be interesting; big mistake! Redundant and disconnected readings/lectures, arbitrary marking. She is really nice and seems to know alot but structure of class is disengaging and frustrating. No consistency in marking and doesn't explain what she's looking for AT ALL! Thinks she's being helpful but is not.
